title: HOW TO SETUP A WORM FARM + WHAT TO FEED WORMS | Vermicomposting | Hey It's A Good Life

tasks.task: Setting up a worm farm or worm bin.
subtasks: Gather necessary materials (cardboard, browns, bedding, grit, worms, greens, amendments).
Add a layer of cardboard to fortify the bin and prevent escape.
Incorporate browns (e.g., leaves, shredded cardboard) as bedding material.
Add compost to improve microbial activity and provide organic material.
Introduce worms into the prepared bin, covering them with a mix of compost and soil.
Provide grit (coffee grounds, eggshells, vermiculite) to aid worm digestion.
Add food scraps (bananas, apple cores, broccoli) sparingly to avoid overfeeding.
Cover food scraps with bedding material to deter pests and manage moisture.
Maintain moisture levels similar to a wrung-out sponge, adjusting as needed.
